snippet: North Korea said Saturday that it would try to launch another long-range rocket later this month, a move that is likely to heighten already strained tensions with Washington and its allies.
abstract: North Korea says it will try to launch another long-range rocket, as country prepares to commemorate death of longtime ruler Kim Jong-il, and as his son Kim Jon-un works to bolster his credentials as leader; launching is likely to prompt international condemnations and heighten tensions with United States and its allies.

byline.contributor: Elisabeth Bumiller contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: North Korea said Saturday that it would try to launch another long-range rocket later this month, a move that is likely to heighten already strained tensions with Washington and its allies.

headline.seo: North Korea Is Preparing to Launch Another Long-Range Rocket
headline.main: North Korea Says It Will Attempt to Test Another Long-Range Rocket
headline.print_headline: North Korea Says It Will Attempt To Test Another Long-Range Rocket
